Guardrail: Check that usage of Principal "*" is not allowed without the usage of proper condition keys
Rationale: A principal setting of "*" allows any authenticated AWS Identity to assume that role, provided they know the ARN. Broadly assumable roles should be considered an anti-pattern in most cases. If a use case arises that it is unavoidable (when you need to provide external access to multiple identities to resources that donâ€™t support resource policies), the Assume Role Policy should be properly scoped with conditions to limit access
Remediation: Add the condition aws:PrincipalOrgId, or aws:PrincipalArn with an account number, or aws:SourceAccount
